reviews.review_msg: as long as you follow the lecture and take notes, you'll be fine with half of the midterms and final. he shares practice exams and answers, and it really helps. the exams are open book which is both good and bad. if you understand the content and do the practices you should be fine. i personally did not study enough and just don't like econ

Don't take econ 115, do yourself a favor and take 103 for extra credit. Exams are insanely difficult with low averages (52%) considering it's open book and laptop. Exams are weirdly worded, and don't expect to boost your grade with quizzes, they're hard too. Econ overall requires time to understand theories, you get lost w/ Josh's lectures.

Lectures were fine, but as a person who doesn't care about Econ, it did not help. All exams were open laptop, which was a good and bad thing. Good thing is that I did not need to deeply memorize the gritty details and they were readily available. Bad thing is that the exam results was very low (52% median score for recent finals).
